p: Most of the plants that found application in ethnomedicine have been documented based on their promising activities against multiple disease-causing microorganisms [ 7, 8]. Research efforts are expediting for better functional understanding of medicinal plants, and this has provided a model for about 25â€“50% of the marketed drugs [ 9]. Antimicrobial activities of useful plants vary; the majority act in synergy [ 10], reducing the side effect of synthetic drugs [ 11], while others act as quorum quenchers [ 12].
